alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 27 at 7:46PM CDT until October 29 at 4:20AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Black River Near Galesville affecting La Crosse and Trempealeau Counties. Black River at Black River Falls affecting Jackson County. Yellow River at Necedah affecting Juneau County. .Excessive rainfall this past week over the Black and Yellow River basins has led to sharp river rises and flooding. While the Black River has crested, the Yellow river is on the rise and the flood crest is moving toward Necedah. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black River at Black River Falls. * WHEN...Until early Sunday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM CDT Friday the stage was 49.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 43.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:00 PM CDT Friday was 51.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon and continue falling. - Flood stage is 47.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 49.1 feet on 04/17/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 1145 AM CDT.
